importantArticles.headline: U.S. pipeline and terminal operator Kinder Morgan left its annual profit forecast unchanged on Wednesday, as it continued to bank on demand increase for natural gas even as President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs sparked uncertainty across the energy industry.  While Kinder Morgan does not expect tariffs to have a significant impact on project economics, it said the uncertainty sparked by them, along with commodity prices, caused the company to be "a little bit more conservative" in communicating its annual outlook.  It expects to post an adjusted profit of $1.27 per share in 2025.
importantArticles.title: Kinder Morgan maintains annual profit forecast on soaring natgas demand
